name: Simple Yet Yummy Tortellini Salad
author: Deb
summary: I was making pasta salad for a picnic and noticed that I ran out of dressing. All I had was extra-virgin olive oil. So, that's all I used, with some salt. It was so much better this way. Everyone wanted the recipe and then couldn't believe that oil was the only thing on this salad. Please try it this way and if you don't agree, you can always add vinegar or something. But, I don't think you will.
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
1 (12 ounce) package spinach and ricotta tortellini
½ pound pitted Kalamata olives, halved
2 tablespoons finely shredded fresh basil, or to taste
¼ cup olive oil, or to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil
Add asparagus and cook uncovered until bright green, 1 to 2 minutes
Drain in a colander and immediately immerse in ice water to cool; drain
Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil
Stir the tortellini into the water and return to a boil; cook until the tortellini float to the top, 5 to 6 minutes; Drain water and run tortellini under cold water to cool
Combine tortellini, asparagus, tomatoes, olives, and and basil in a bowl
Drizzle olive oil over tortellini mixture and stir to coat; season with salt
